issues.description: The Rideable.messageOnRide method signature is inconsistent between the problem statement/template and the solution. The problem UML, the task description, and the example usage in the template Main (problem) expect messageOnRide() with no parameters and a return like "Riding on [Animal Type] [name]". In the solution repository Rideable.messageOnRide declares a parameter (String equipment) and Pig/Seal implement messageOnRide(String equipment) returning strings that include the equipment. This parameter mismatch changes the interface contract and will confuse students (and break code/tests) because the example usage and specification use the no-argument form.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Rideable.messageOnRide signature consistent with the problem statement and template example. Recommended: change the interface to declare String messageOnRide() (no parameters) and update Pig and Seal to implement messageOnRide() returning exactly "Riding on [Animal Type] [name]". Alternatively, if the equipment parameter is intentional, update the problem statement, UML, and template examples to require messageOnRide(String equipment) and adjust the example return strings accordingly. The first option (align solution to no-arg method) preserves the current problem description and example usage.

issues.description: The problem statement and template expect a parameterless messageOnRide() that returns a String (UML and usage in Main call r.messageOnRide()). The solution repository defines Rideable.messageOnRide(String equipment) and implements messageOnRide with a String parameter in Pig and Seal. This changes the method signature for the same conceptual operation (riding an animal), breaking the mapping between the problem description/template usage and the solution implementation and creating a compile / mental-mapping mismatch for students.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Rideable API consistent with the problem statement and template: change Rideable.messageOnRide(String equipment) to messageOnRide():String in solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Rideable.java and adapt Pig and Seal to implement the parameterless messageOnRide() returning "Riding on [Animal Type] [name]". Alternatively (less recommended), update the problem statement and template to require a messageOnRide(String equipment) signature and update examples to call it with an equipment argument — but the simpler fix is to remove the extra parameter from the solution so names/signatures align.
